section.p: Beverly relies on the excellent transitive dependency management system of Apache Karaf, which is documented here. Karaf feature repository files are distributed with Beverly, so the process of deploying Beverly has these stages:

li.a: Make sure that your Karaf instance has a runnning message broker to which Fedora can publish its changes.

ol.li: Connect your Fedora repository to your Karaf-housed message broker.
Install Beverly to your local Maven repository.
Ensure that your Karaf instance can draw upon your local Maven repository.
Load the feature repositories into Karaf.
Configure Beverly to send index records to your Apache Solr index.
Load some objects into your Fedora repository to take advantage of Beverly's indexing.
